title: Ticket #1667: Persistent config params hard to debug when setting them fails
description:
If ENABLE_PERSISTENT_CONFIG is false, one gets this message from =condor_config_val -set 'SCHEDD.DAEMON_SHUTDOWN' '(TOTALJOBADS == 0)': 

"SCHEDD.DAEMON_SHUTDOWN = (TOTALJOBADS == 0)" on schedd
schedd10828Metronome-2.5.3@nmi-0065.batlab.cs.wisc.edu
<192.168.0.65:43722> failed.

However the schedd log says this: 

09/20 14:03:55 (fd:13) (pid:10838) PERMISSION GRANTED to unauthenticated user
from host 192.168.0.65 for remote config SCHEDD.DAEMON_SHUTDOWN, access level
OWNER: reason: OWNER authorization policy allows IP address 192.168.0.65;
identifiers used for this remote host: 192.168.0.65,nmi-0065.batlab.cs.wisc.edu

Why did it fail? Apparently, there are code paths in condor_config.cpp in set_persistent_config() which don't say.

I found the code path, and am making it emit a better output.
